name: pitilessly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a cruel way that shows no sympathy for others: They're said to be elaborately polite, brave as lions, and pitilessly cruel. I was teased pitilessly every time I spoke for having a "posh" accent.
severely and unpleasantly: By 3.30 it was raining so pitilessly that the sky had turned black and all the street lights were on. The women's ward was damp, grey, and pitilessly bare. See
pitiless
More examplesFewer examplesA man has died violently and pitilessly at the hands of angry strangers.Nature is not cruel, only pitilessly indifferent.This is officially the least-visited region of Spain; poor, arid and pitilessly hot.
